1. You are my heir and I am your elder sister. That is, you and I are my mother. The vacant land and the ground floor R.C.C. terrace house as written in paragraph III below are a legacy to me, that is, after the death of my father and your grandfather Samapathi Rao Narayana Rao, I have acquired the right to the vacant land and the ground floor R.C.C. terrace house as written in the schedule, and with the intention of providing you with some fixed income for your livelihood, out of my love and affection for you, you have contributed to my hardships and pleasures up to this day and have been taking care of my care, maintenance, care, medical expenses, etc., and are under my care and affection. Therefore, out of love for you, I hereby give you a vacant plot of land and a ground floor R.C.C terraced house constructed as per the Schedule, valued at Rs. 9,42,000/-(Nine Lakh Forty Two Thousand Rupees) as a settlement and take possession of the property as per the Schedule immediately. You have taken possession of the property from me immediately. This is a ground floor R.C.C terrace house constructed by you on vacant land as per the schedule, paying the government fees, panchayat taxes etc., and constructing buildings, structures etc. on the property as per the schedule without my permission, and you, your sons and grandsons, shall enjoy eternal happiness with full rights of donation and sale of all the money in the future. Neither you nor your heirs, nor I nor my heirs, will ever be able to claim any rights over this property. I declare that this settlement property has not been subject to any other encroachments or encumbrances, that it is an undisputed property, that there are no other claimants to this property except me, that this property is not an assigned property under the A.P. 9/77 Act, and that it does not belong to the Government or its agencies. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 257 of 2026, dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Badana Saraswati in favour of her nephew, Sampathirao Anil Kumar Raju, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 74.11 Sq.Yds., bearing house number 1-119, comprised in survey number 109-10, assessment number 211106000161, situated in Lakhidasupuram Village, Revenue Village, Nandigam Mandal within the District of Srikakulam registered at sub-registrar office Tekkali(114) is bounded as follows: North by: C C Road South by: Mugada Ramarao’s RCC slab house. East by: Sampathirao Sujatha’s RCC slab house. West by: C.C. Road
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
